intro: Verbesina centroboyacana, commonly known as the Boyacá yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow floral heads and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
